title: Charles Rees (rugby league)
text:
Charles "Charlie" Rees (birth unknown – death unknown) was a Welsh professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1900s and 1910s. He played at representative level for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a> (prior to the specialist positions of; ), during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Playing career.
International honours.
Charlie Rees won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> while at Salford in 1912.
Championship Final appearances.
During Charles Rees' time there was <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a>'s 5-3 victory over <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1913–14 season</a>.
